column4: okay this is a question I don't know if anyone has an answer for: I have a dell laptop, which by default has a bunch of system-keys where the F keys are, and you have to hold down Fn to access the Fkeys, on windows this is a good idea, as you don't use Fkeys all that much, on linux its very annoying
Is there a way to reverse this behavior?
I have those too. You get used to it. You can shortcut their functions using System-Preferences-Keyboard Shortcuts
